spec.name: The House of Rabbi Chaim Pinto
spec.description: The House of Rabbi Chaim Pinto is a historical site located in the heart of the Old Medina's former Jewish Quarter (Mellah). It is the former residence of **Rabbi Chaim Pinto** (1743â€“1845), a highly revered saint and religious leader. The house is a site of pilgrimage and veneration, representing the deep spiritual and cultural history of Morocco's Jewish community.

people.comment: Highly revered Moroccan Rabbi and saint.

timeline.title: Establishment Period
timeline.description: The house was established as the Rabbi's residence (Approximate early 19th-century date).

access.comment: Access is generally granted to visitors with respect and sometimes a small donation.
